item.title: Most Addictive Open-World Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games are captivating, making it hard for players to tear themselves away.
  • Games like Far Cry 5 and Red Dead Redemption 2 offer immersive experiences and engaging stories.
  • Titles like Cyberpunk 2077 and The Witcher 3 provide incredible action and storytelling for players to enjoy.

Open-world gaming can be tough for people to tear their eyes away from, at times. The combination of an engaging sandbox, captivating stories, memorable characters, and entertaining side content ensures that players can invest a significant amount of time in these high-quality open-world games.

Getting back to normal life can be hard, since these games grab hold of players and never let go. Completing just one more mission or open-world activity can make for such an alluring prospect that players might even see the sun rise if they started playing at night!

Far Cry 5

Clear Outposts And Take Out The Seed Family One by One

Far Cry 5
9 /10
22
7.9 /10
Released
March 27, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Far Cry 5 made some much-needed improvements to the series' formula, as minor as they might have been. Players loved the effortless exploration and improved action, ensuring that both combat and stealth would feel great.

Taking down cultists in droves and killing off the Seed family members one at a time is a hypnotic experience. At a certain point, players will become so invested in the action that trying to quit the game will become a Herculean effort.

Red Dead Redemption 2

Even With The Failure Of Red Dead Online, This Game Is Still Fun

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
172
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Red Dead Redemption 2 is one of the greatest video games ever made. After a slow first chapter, the game opens up and lets players interact with one of the most vibrant and lived-in open worlds of all time.

Arthur Morgan is a great character, and players will love seeing him develop and reach great heights, as players are invested in the story of an outlaw group that is being left behind in a technologically advanced age. It makes for a great time and ensures that players will have a blast as they clock in a ton of hours in both this title and the online component, which is fun despite Rockstar's perceived lack of support.

Minecraft

Let The Creative Juices Flow

Minecraft
190
9.0 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
6 Images
Powered by

Minecraft took the world by storm, letting players enjoy one of the greatest indie experiences they can get their hands on. The game amassed such major popularity that Microsoft paid the big bucks to take this title out of Notch's hands.

The game constantly receives updates and boasts a massive multiplayer community, making it easy enjoy thousands of hours in this title. The creativity that players can display in this title is unmatched. Anyone can boot up Minecraft and have a blast with what this title has to offer.

Cyberpunk 2077

Incredible Action And Storytelling

Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
123
8.9 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
6 Images
Powered by

Cyberpunk 2077 faced a tough launch where everyone turned on it, only for CD Projekt Red to update and patch this game so many times that its reputation has taken a complete U-turn. As things stand, V's adventures in Night City make for an absorbing affair that fans will find it hard to tear themselves away from.

The quality of this game is palpable for everyone to see as they spend hours exploring Night City and getting lost in its neon magic. The writing in this game is incredible, the combat is off the charts, and the vibes are immaculate, making for a highly enjoyable open-world game that will occupy players for hours on end.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Exploring This Nordic World Is A Blast

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
81
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
6 Images
Powered by

There's a reason why some gamers called in sick to work just so they could spend the entire day playing Skyrim . The game is simply in a class of its own in terms of its exploration. Players can find something interesting to sink their teeth into time and time again.

The beauty of this game still shines, especially with mods ensuring that the game feels as modern and engaging as ever. In fact, some people may argue that the act of modding itself is also highly addictive, as players figure out the best way to optimize this game for them.

Grand Theft Auto 5

With GTA Online, This Game Is Impossible To Put Down

Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10
151
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
5 Images
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto 5 was a technical marvel so ahead of its time that it required a whole new console generation to push this game to its limit. The stories of Michael, Franklin, and Trevor intertwine to make one highly addictive cocktail that fans will want to imbibe time and time again.

Getting drunk on this game's chaos and amazing missions as players enjoy a cinematic adventure for the ages never gets old. The single-player mode is a massive time sink as is, but GTA Online will also grab a player's attention with the sheer amount of content this multiplayer experience has to offer.

Fallout: New Vegas

Mold The Courier In The Player's Image

Fallout: New Vegas
8 /10
22
8.9 /10
Released
October 19, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Fallout: New Vegas is a legendary open-world RPG that is Obsidian Entertainment's magnum opus. It's the perfect combination of modern and classic Fallout that fans will find unputdownable.

From the moment the Courier is shot in the head by Benny, players can embark on the adventure of a lifetime as they head to Night City and play a huge role in the events that shape the Mojave. The factions, quests, and role-playing opportunities are just a few of the many reasons why New Vegas is a must-play experience for fans of quality open-world games.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Geralt's Adventures Are Absolutely Riveting

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
55
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

Ever since The Witcher 3 was revealed, fans were floored by the quality of the content on offer here. Everything, from the main story to what seemed like the most banal of sidequests, featured incredible writing that made everything memorable.

Geralt could transform from a run-of-the-mill witcher into a whirlwind of death as players gained levels and explored numerous regions of the Continent. With the next-gen patch, The Witcher 3 remains one of the finest and most addictive open-world games players can get their hands on.

item.title: The Best Post-Apocalyptic Games of All Time
item.description:
Post-apocalyptic settings are one of the few things that excel in all forms of media, whether that be books, movies, or video games. The idea of a post-apocalyptic landscape seems to bring out numerous emotions in people, whether it be fear, intrigue, or even adrenaline-pumping excitement, depending on the theme. In theory, video games can offer a superior post-apocalyptic experience to books and films, as they can uniquely put their audience in the shoes of the main character as they journey through the deprived world before them.

Unfortunately, many development teams fail to realize the potential of how immersive a post-apocalyptic game can be and instead use the genre as a gimmick to improve otherwise bland and generic games. The games on this list, however, offer fantastic post-apocalyptic worlds that excel in either letting the player explore their landscape, telling a gripping story, or offering unique gameplay mechanics to fit the morbid reality.

Updated September 25th, 2025, by Jack Pursey: This list of the best post-apocalyptic games of all time has been updated to improve the layout and image quality.

Stray

OpenCritic Rating: 83

Stray
9 /10
14
8.4 /10
Released
July 19, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
BlueTwelve Studio
Publisher(s)
Annapurna Interactive
Platform(s)
PS4, PS5, PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S
Powered by

Many of the best post-apocalyptic games make a point of letting the player know exactly what caused the world to fall into a state of ruin. In a lot of cases, this ends up being pretty obvious, with zombies (or something similar with a slightly different name) being the main culprits. Stray takes a somewhat different approach, though, thrusting players into a futuristic version of Hong Kong with little explanation.

Exploring this neon-infused world as a cat provides players with a brand-new perspective, which in turn helps to distract from some of the bigger issues at hand. Questions like "What happened to all of the humans?" and "What's the deal with the Zurks?" will soon fall by the wayside, with players quickly getting lost in a world that's full of character and adorable feline interactions that are just waiting to be uncovered.

Rust

OpenCritic Rating: 67

Rust
8.6 /10
Released
February 8, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Facepunch Studios
Publisher(s)
Facepunch Studios
Platform(s)
macOS, PC, PS4, Xbox One
Powered by

In most other post-apocalyptic games, it is the life forms that have come to inhabit the world that players find themselves in that serve as the main source of danger, be that terrifying video game zombies or some other form of mutated creature. Rust does feature irradiated animals, such as bears and wolves, but it ends up being other humans that players really need to worry about, rather than these monstrous mammals.

The shoot-on-sight nature of online survival games can be frustrating at first, but it's arguably a lot more realistic than a post-apocalyptic game in which all NPCs are friendly. Resources are limited, after all, with food and healing supplies being in particularly short supply. With that in mind, it's only natural that players would be willing to kill for these rare items when push comes to shove.

Stellar Blade

OpenCritic Rating: 82

Stellar Blade
9 /10
40
9.0 /10
Released
April 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Shift Up
Publisher(s)
Sony Interactive Entertainment
Platform(s)
PC, PS5
Powered by

Much like Guerrilla Games' Horizon series, Stellar Blade serves as proof that a post-apocalyptic world can still be beautiful. Granted, the 2024 title takes a much more reserved approach when it comes to the idea of a world being reclaimed by nature, but there's still an inherent beauty in some of its dusty and desolate locales.

Unlike a lot of other great games with post-apocalyptic settings, Stellar Blade has no real survival elements to speak of, though that's not to say that players should expect a walk in the park. Combat can be brutal, albeit equally rewarding, making this a great option for those looking for a fun and stylish challenge.

Days Gone

OpenCritic Rating: 72

Days Gone
8 /10
37
9.1 /10
Released
April 26, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Bend Studio
Publisher(s)
Sony
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4
Powered by

Despite hundreds of thousands of people signing a petition calling for Sony to release a sequel, the chances of a new Days Gone game seem pretty slim right now. That's unfortunate, as, despite its somewhat disappointing Metascore, many consider it to be one of the best open-world survival games of the modern era, thanks largely to its immersive storytelling and well-written characters.

Players assume the role of Deacon St. John, a former bounty hunter struggling to survive in a post-apocalyptic world filled with zombie-like creatures called Freaks. Though players are surrounded by death and danger on all sides, the world that they get to explore feels as though it's truly alive, which can encourage players to take risks when they probably shouldn't. The experience on offer is therefore a tense one, but also a lot of fun.

State of Decay

OpenCritic Rating: 74

State of Decay
8 /10
9.0 /10
Released
June 5, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Undead Labs
Publisher(s)
Microsoft
Platform(s)
Xbox 360, Xbox One, PC
Powered by

Like Days Gone , Undead Labs' State of Decay series struggled to impress critics, though it has garnered something of a cult following within the Xbox ecosystem. Both the original and its sequel take place in a post-apocalyptic world that's infested with zombies and take players on a somewhat singular journey that very few other games can match.

With an infinite supply of zombies and a wide array of weapons with which to dispatch them, the State of Decay games are more about having fun picking apart zombies than they are about evoking feelings of fear. In that respect, they're a lot like the Dead Rising games, only they boast a much larger sandbox in which to play around and place a lot more emphasis on crafting and resource management.

The Division

OpenCritic Rating: 79

Tom Clancys The Division
8.5 /10
Released
March 8, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Massive Entertainment
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One
Powered by

After a genetically engineered super-virus known as Green Poison brings humanity to its knees, civilization collapses, and chaos and anarchy soon fill the void. Players are left to explore what remains of New York City, which now boasts an ever-expanding dark zone in which all decency and decorum are consumed by evil inclinations and despicable desires.

In many ways, The Division is exactly what one might expect from a Tom Clancy game, particularly when it comes to combat and mechanics. However, the game's wonderfully well-realized post-apocalyptic depiction of New York really helps to set it apart from many of its peers and is well worth a visit for those curious about what the end of the world might look like.

Mad Max

OpenCritic Rating: 69

Mad Max
7 /10
11
8.5 /10
Released
September 1, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Avalanche Studios
Publisher(s)
Warner Bros. Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Xbox One
Powered by

Mad Max was released in 2015 but isn't a tie-in to the hit movie Mad Max: Fury Road, which was released in theatres just four months earlier. Although the film was well-received by fans and critics, many players were happy that the game wasn't a direct tie-in, as movie tie-in games have a poor reputation today following numerous releases in the 2000s that felt like cash grabs.

Mad Max impressed fans and critics with its explosive action and well-designed open world that is a joy to explore. For this reason, many regard it as one of the most underrated video games of the past decade, with very few people having checked it out despite its obvious quality.

I Am Alive

OpenCritic Rating: N/A

I Am Alive
5 /10
7.0 /10
Released
March 7, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft Shanghai
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

Ubisoft's I Am Alive may not be able to hold a candle to the other games on this list in terms of its objective quality, but it deserves a spot nonetheless for implementing some of the most ambitious and forward-thinking ideas that the post-apocalyptic genre has ever seen.

Such ideas include the devastating impact that climbing, jumping, and other strenuous movements can have on the player's well-being, as well as the lack of ammunition that forces players to utilize bold strategies like aiming an empty gun at enemies, in hopes that they believe it's loaded. The realistic take on combat was a breath of fresh air for the genre, and one that makes many other self-proclaimed realistic post-apocalyptic adventures look like Rambo in comparison.

Death Stranding

OpenCritic Rating: 83

Death Stranding
4 /10
28
7.7 /10
Released
November 8, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Kojima Productions
Publisher(s)
Sony, 505 Games
Platform(s)
iOS, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

When Death Stranding was announced, it instantly became one of the gaming industry's most highly anticipated titles. The baffling trailers intrigued players who had no idea what type of game Death Stranding was going to be, a theme that continued when Hideo Kojima confusingly described it as the first "strand game."

Most gameplay predictions from fans proved to be completely wrong, as there weren't many who predicted that Death Stranding would predominantly consist of extreme post-apocalyptic Amazon delivery. The unique gameplay divided players, but the story was universally praised, making Death Stranding worth considering even if the gameplay sounds off-putting.

Wasteland 3

OpenCritic Rating: 86

Wasteland 3
9 /10
9.6 /10
Released
August 28, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
inXile entertainment
Publisher(s)
Deep Silver
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Wasteland 3 was initially released in August 2020 and had the tough task of improving upon its critically acclaimed predecessor, Wasteland 2. The game features a similar style of turn-based tactics combat as the XCOM series, but differentiates itself with its heavier focus on role-playing mechanics.

InXile Entertainment's game was well-received by fans and critics, exemplified by its 85 Metascore on PC and Best Role-Playing nomination at The Game Awards 2020, an award that eventually went to the remake of Final Fantasy 7 . Still, those looking for a great post-apocalyptic video game could certainly do an awful lot worse.

item.title: Best Games Where You Can Rewind Time
item.description:
Summary

  • Time-control turns mistakes into toolsrewind to retry, experiment, and ease frustrating moments.
  • Time control powers puzzles, combat, racing, and story, shaping tension between fate and freedom.
  • Rewind systems reduce punishment and encourage experimentation, from Sands of Time to Forza.

Time is one of those wild, uncontrollable things, both in reality and even in video games. Health bars can be restored, missions can be retried, but a mistake made in the moment tends to linger forever. Some games, though, break this sacred rule by letting players bend and rewind time itself.

Whether it's through puzzle mechanics, as an interesting narrative tool, or simply as a means to avoid crashing into a guardrail, the ability to rewind time creates a fascinating tension between fate and freedom, and these games utilize it best.

Prince Of Persia: The Sands Of Time

A Dagger That Cheats Death

Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
9.2 /10
Released
October 28, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen // Blood, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Platform(s)
PlayStation 2, Xbox (Original), Nintendo GameCube, Nintendo Game Boy Advance, PC, Mobile
Powered by

Even though this game came out more than twenty years ago, few games since have captured the fantasy of rewinding time as elegantly as The Sands of Time does. With the Dagger of Time in hand, the Prince never has to give up on a mistimed jump or a nasty fall. Instead, players can just rewind a fatal mistake and create a rhythm where parkour feels challenging but never unfair.

It's also central to the whole story. The ability to control time is both a blessing and a burden, and the Prince carries this heavy weight that drives the plot forward. The game perfectly balances acrobatic platforming, slick sword fighting, and puzzle-solving while carefully weaving in the fluidity of letting players rewind mistakes.

Braid

Indie Time Travel With Strings Attached

Braid
9.4 /10
Released
August 6, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Language, Mild Cartoon Violence
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

Braid is a game that's just as much about the philosophies of time as it is about rewinding it. Every single world has its own unique twist, from objects that just won't reverse to enemies that only move when you do. What starts as a charming little platformer quickly morphs into a lesson on consequence, obsession, and control.

And theres no catch. Rewinding is unlimited, making failure totally inconsequential. The game, instead of punishing the player for mistakes, begs for experimentation. By the end, the narrative and mechanics collide in a way that just stays with players long after the credits have rolled. It perfectly mixes the concept of rewinding time into both its gameplay and storytelling.

Quantum Break

A TV Show You Can Play

Quantum Break
9 /10
8.0 /10
Released
April 5, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Remedy Entertainment
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox One
Powered by

Before they hit it big with Control , Remedy went all-in on time-bending combat and live-action drama with Quantum Break . Jack Joyce's powers let players freeze enemies in their tracks, reverse firefights, or just sprint through reality where everything is slowed down. Every battle features time itself as the weapon.

The game also tries a crazy TV-esque narrative. Between chapters, players literally watch live-action episodes where their choices influence events and outcomes. Although it was a bit divisive at launch, Quantum Break really stands out as an ambitious attempt to make time manipulation more than just a gimmick.

Forza Horizon 5

Driving Back The Clock

Forza Horizon 5
9 /10
27
8.4 /10
Released
November 9, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone // In-Game Purchases, Users Interact
Developer(s)
Playground Games
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

While the Forza Horizon series is mostly all about high-speed thrills, the rewind feature is a quiet MVP. In Forza Horizon 5 , a disastrous crash doesnt mean restarting the whole race. Just a quick rewind lets players retry that corner, preserving their momentum while also not sacrificing immersion.

What makes the system special is how it eases players into racing without making things frustrating. Casuals can still tackle intense challenges without facing constant frustration, while perfectionist drifters can fine-tune every attack angle. In a genre obsessed with shaving milliseconds wherever possible, being able to control the hands of time is priceless.

Blinx: The Time Sweeper

A Cat With A Clock

Blinx: The Time Sweeper
Platformer
Systems
Released
October 7, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone Due To Mild Violence
Developer(s)
Artoon
Platform(s)
Xbox (Original)
Powered by

Long before Ratchet & Clank were getting involved in timeline-hopping shenanigans, Microsoft had already experimented with a time-traveling platformer. In Blinx: The Time Sweeper , players control a janitor cat with a vacuum that controls time itself. Rewinding, fast-forwarding, and recording actions gave the game an unusual and refreshing twist on standard platforming.

The ambition was huge for 2002, even if the execution was uneven at times. Some puzzles required rewinding environmental hazards, while others demanded carefully recording one's movements. Blinx: The Time Sweeper wasnt flawless, but it sure was bold, carving a really unique spot in early Xbox history.

Life Is Strange

Undoing The Past

Life is Strange
11
9.0 /10
Released
January 30, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
Dontnod Entertainment
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One
Powered by

Taking the rewind mechanic out of combat and putting it directly into conversations, choices, and relationships, Life Is Strange uses the ability more for narrative than gameplay. Max Caulfields time-traveling powers turn every small interaction into a moment of weight. A wrong answer in dialogue isnt a loosened arrow. Players can try again, this time with more context.

The system highlights how choices and their consequences are never as simple as they seem. Players can go back to fix a mistake, only to end up changing something else far more significant. Combined with an intimate story of friendship, grief, and identity, the rewind ability becomes way more than just a trick. Its the emotional center of the entire journey.

Timelie

A Puzzle In Reverse

Timelie
Adventure
Strategy
Indie
Systems
Released
May 20, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Urnique Studio
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, iOS, Android, Windows, macOS
Powered by

Timelie puts time manipulation into a blender with cooperative puzzle-solving. The result has players guide a girl and her cat through stealth sequences where every move can be rewound and adjusted across a timeline resembling video-editing software. Its a game about precision, planning, and foresight.

The mechanic allows for infinite amounts of trial and error without penalty. Each level is a little film reel where players can scrub back and forth until they find the perfect sequence. Pairing the forgivingness of a rewind ability with the tension of controlling two characters at once, Timelie shows a unique take on puzzle design.

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Remake Trilogy Director Shares Update About Part 3
item.description:
Final Fantasy 7 Remake trilogy director Naoki Hamaguchi stated that the keyword for the saga's highly anticipated third part has already been decided, and that it will dictate gameplay and story direction. Hamaguchi also noted that the past keywords for Final Fantasy 7 Remake and Rebirth , "reunion" and "bonds," both correlated with each game's main themes and philosophies.

While Final Fantasy 7 Remake and Rebirth originally launched as timed exclusives on PlayStation consoles, Square Enix has since shifted to a multi-platform approach for its major releases. After sharing that Final Fantasy 7 Remake will launch on Nintendo Switch 2 and Xbox Series X/S consoles on January 22, 2026, Hamaguchi added that the rest of the Final Fantasy 7 Remake trilogy would also arrive on those platforms. However, it is currently unclear if FF7 Remake 's third chapter will be a timed exclusive on the PlayStation platform or if it will be a multi-platform launch from the start.

The Keyword For Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3's Design Philosophy Has Been Decided

Weeks after sharing that Square Enix had an internal release window for FF7 Remake Part 3 , Hamaguchi clued fans in on another aspect of its ongoing development. In a September interview with German media outlet JPGames, Hamaguchi stated that the keyword used to shape the upcoming chapter's gameplay and story themes has already been decided by the development team. However, Hamaguchi stopped short of revealing Part 3 's keyword, but offered fans some context behind the keywords used for Final Fantasy 7 Remake and Rebirth . For FF7 Remake, the keyword "reunion" described how Square Enix wanted fans to be reintroduced to the saga's main characters and setting. For Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , the keyword "bonds" symbolized the relationships that each character had with one another, and how those bonds strengthened over the course of the story.

Hamaguchi also said that Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3 had some playable developer builds where the theme can be figured out through gameplay. Hamaguchi confirmed that Final Fantasy 7 Remake 's third chapter would also be the saga's climax, and that it would be "a really great send off" for the series. The story of Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3 should pick up immediately where Rebirth left off, following the events at the Forgotten Capital.

Although Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3 is not listed on Square Enix's itinerary for the 2025 Tokyo Game Show, Hamaguchi teased fans by stating they would not have to wait long to hear more information. Only time will tell when Square Enix will show fans more about the trilogy's finale.

48
9.2 /10
9 /10

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

Follow
Followed
RPG
Systems
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 92 /100 Critics Rec: 97%
Released
February 29, 2024
ESRB

Developer(s)
Square Enix

Square Enix

item.title: All Hinako Outfits and Costumes in Silent Hill f
item.description:
Silent Hill f upholds the tradition to giving players an option to customize the look of the main protagonist with alternative outfits and costumes. Players have an option to change up Hinako's look to wear a different outfit throughout the playthrough, which will eventually make its way into the cutscenes too. However, the outfit select is limited, depending on which edition of the game you've purchased. Let's check out all Hinako's outfits that players can use in Silent Hill f .

All Hinako Costumes in Silent Hill f (Outfits)

There are a total of three different costumes (outfits) players can equip for Hinako in Silent Hill f . While two of the costumes are slight variations of one another, the third one drastically changes Hinako's appearance, adding a splash of pink to an otherwise dreadful journey through a monster-filled nightmare.

Here are all the available outfits in the game, and how players can access them.

Costume Showcase

Outfit Name

Description

How to Get

Navy Sailor School Uniform

Designated school uniform.

The traditional uniform of Ebisugaoka Middle School that's unlocked by default. Comes with all editions of the game, without any conditions.

White Sailor School Uniform

Pure white. Innocent White

The white variant of the default costume that players will get after pre-ordering any edition of Silent Hill f . If you've missed out on pre-ordering the game, there's no way to acquire this after launch.

Pink Rabbit Costume

Why the rabbit ears?

A pink costume with rabbit ears that players will get by purchasing the Silent Hill f Deluxe edition.

What is the Best Costume to Wear in Silent Hill f?

The costumes (outfits) available in Silent Hill f are for mere cosmetic purposes , and do not alter the gameplay in any way. So, players can pick and choose any costume for Hinako to wear during their playthrough of the game.

Hinako will show up in cutscenes wearing the costume you select.

With that said, players can try going with the default Hinako look for their first playthrough, to experience the game's narrative as they've seen in trailers and other promotional materials. Since Silent Hill f requires players to complete multiple playthroughs of the game via NG+ to get other endings, they can use the alternative outfits in the runs to keep things fresh.

How to Change Costumes in Silent Hill f

There are two main ways to change costumes (outfits) in Silent Hill f .

  • New Game : Players can select a costume for Hinako when they either start a new game, or new game plus (NG+). The option shows up right after you select the difficulty settings for Silent Hill f .
  • Hokora Shrine : You also have an option to change Hinako's outfit during your playthrough by visiting any Hokora shrine in the game. Once you interact with a shrine, choose the "Change Costume" option and you can switch up Hinako's look in a few clicks.
